title: Issues After Anti-Cheat Patch...
body:
I tried to watch a replay today and it took FOREVER to load up then once it did it was super laggy and I couldn't even watch it.

Then shortly thereafter I tried to play a ranked game and after champ select when the game was supposed to load I was just stuck at a black screen. Eventually league told me to try to reconnect and every time I did it failed. Eventually the game resulted in a remake...

My wife was queued up with me as well and could not connect; same issue.

What is going on? I'm not using any 3rd party software except razer synapse. Riot please...

Is there some sort of setting on my modem/router that would cause this after the recent patch?

Update: Tried practice tool and same sort of deal it tries to connect forever and just fails. This was happening to me on PBE as well but not on live until this latest patch today.

replies.body: I had it happen once before and I just uninstalled the league client and re-installed it and didn’t have the problem after that.

Hi Just Dodge The Q,

You definitely have something on your PC that is causing issues with our recent changes with what you've described. 

Can you try uninstalling Razer Synapse? We did do a check on our end to make sure that this product worked fine with our new tech, but it's possible you are using an older version. If that doesn't solve your issue, can you temporarily disable (or uninstall) your security product and let us know if that helps? Thanks!

I will like to give info as well, I am not having any problems but I am using Razer Synapse as well, software version 2.21(not the newest update) That being said I use it a bit differently then most people, I use it for my keypad ( I play league with a keypad instead of my keyboard, I use the exact keypad Magicarpusedfly does the Razer Nostromo) and as such I do not have the software run at startup(because some reason the software glitches some games) I run it when I start league or just before I get into game.

The main point of this is that I am not having problems with Razer Synapse, It could be because I am using an older version, could be because I am starting it not on start up, or/and it could be because I am using an old piece of razer hardware. Just thought this would help you out @Riot Bugcheck

PS. I only tested Practice tool today(as I read this post to see if  I was affected, I did play an aram yesterday but it might have been before the Anti-cheat came out

Shouldn't simply ending the task via task manager work if that was what was causing the issue (Razer Synapse) ? 
I don't have any anti-virus security software as it slows my pc down and I've never felt they were worth it. I try to keep my pc as barebones as possible which is why it's pretty awkward I am running into this issue.

It's Windows 7.

Is there some sort of diagnostic I can run to show you?

To be safe, I'd recommend completely uninstalling it. However, if it doesn't fix your issue, it would be awesome if you could bring up "msinfo32" and export your results so that I can go over them.

You can do that by pressing Start+R (to open up the "Run" window), entering msinfo32, selecting the "System Summary" item in the left pane, navigating to "File", and then selecting "Export". You can name the file whatever you want. 

It may take a few minutes to collect all your system information. When that's complete, upload the file to [Drive](https://www.google.com/drive/), [Dropbox](https://www.dropbox.com/), or your favorite file sharing website and share the link on the forums.

Thank you!

System Summary:

https://drive.google.com/open?id=1Hs-eIp_-NsVxIePqDYdyzeUFv0glaWSm

Tried uninstalling all the gaming related software I had and loading up Practice Tool. It takes about 10 minutes trying to load after champ select and then once it finally does get in the game it is running at 1 fps (laggy unplayable etc). Same as it was before. I have very little running actively when I play the game. Could it be something installed that isn't actually running? Or some sort of network issue since it is happening to my wife as well? Only started happening after this latest anti-cheat patch (was playing games yesterday on 8.12 fine).

SS showing 1 FPS =(
https://drive.google.com/file/d/19f5Hr0WrE7qWPcaGK8K2BfmggamTnjPE/view?usp=sharing

Hey there,

Thanks for sharing the results. It's probably something running on both you and your wife's computers so targeting shared software between them is recommended. For now, I'd recommend disabling (temporarily uninstalling if necessary) the following and see if it fixes your issue (in the practice tool):
1. Malware Bytes 
2. Proxifier

If that doesn't fix your problem, open "msconfig" (Start+R) and select "Diagnostic startup". You'll have to reboot. You can check if that fixes your issue too.

Please keep me in the loop, though. Thank you for your help in troubleshooting the problem. I realize it's not an enjoyable experience, but I really do appreciate your help.

I tried both uninstalling those programs and diagnostic startup.

Neither of those things worked. It's pretty hard to imagine it's software related at this point when I disabled every non-microsoft startup/service. Not sure what I'm supposed to do at this point I've never had any issue running League or any other game for that matter.

I appreciate your attempts at helping even though they were unsuccessful...

I have a router/gateway modem (all in 1) and have the firewall disabled and can't find any security measures that are enabled.

Maybe it's time for you guys to start considering it's something on Riot's end related to the patch. It seems like a lot of other people are having this issue. Any followup advice?

It looks like you're able to get into the game with your last screenshot even though it's completely unplayable. 

Previously, you weren't able to launch the game at all, right? Only after uninstalling the applications was the game able to load? Just trying to understand your situation.

Thanks for working with me.

EDIT: What would help me is if you create a memory dump of the game when you're loaded. You can do that by opening up Task Manager, right-clicking on the "League of Legends.exe" process, and selecting "Create Dump File". Upload that too and share the link ;).

DOUBLE BONUS EDIT: Can you try updating your system drivers? In particular, your graphics card drivers.

I tried to create a dump file for "League of Legends.exe" when it finally got into game w/ 1 fps and it said "access denied" when I clicked "create dump file"...

Plz riot just want to play league =(.  Updating graphics card drivers now will post back but I'm not feeling very hopeful. Others are having this exact same issue we should be able to figure this out.

Do you have a list of things that WOULD interfere with the new anticheat systems?
